text: parts per million is a way of finding
the concentration of the solution it's
represented by the letters PPM or parts
per million the formula is mass of
compound x divided by total mass of
solution multiplied by 10 6 or million
now since this is a ratio the units
cancel and PPM is unitless so now let's
do an example using parts per
million in this example we start with 25
moles of water in a cup here's our cup
the blue dots are the water molecules
nothing else exists you want to find the
amount in grams of HCL to add to create
a 990,000 parts per million solution so
we want to go from this cup to this cup
where this cup contains HCL molecules in
a concentration of 90,000 parts per
million we want to find the amount and
GRS of the red dots we need to add to
create such a solution the first step is
to calculate the molecular weight of
water to calculate the molecular weight
of water we simply add the atomic weight
of oxygen plus 2 times the atomic weight
of H because we have a Subs of two so we
get 16 G per mole of oxygen plus 2 * 1 G
per mole of H gives us 8 18 G per Mo so
the molecular weight of water is 18 G
per Mo now to find the amount in G of
water that we have in our initial
solution we need to multiply the
molecular weight by the 25 moles of H2O
that we have so 18 G per mole time 25
moles gives you
450 now moles cancel and grams are left
so we have 450 G of
H2O now we want to find the amount of
HCL we need to add in terms of GRS to
create a 90,000 parts per million
solution so we simply use the parts per
million formula we say well we want to
create a 90,000 G or parts per million
solution equals x is the amount of HCL
in G we need to add divided by the total
amount of GRS we have in a solution so
we we already have 450 G of of water
plus the amount of HCL and G we will add
so plus x * 10 6 or 1 million we do a
little bit of simple algebra to solve
for x we divide through by 10 6 we get
90,000 / 1 million equals this guy now
we multiply through by 450 + x and we
get 0.09 which which is simply this guy
time 450 + x equals the X was left over
on that side so equals x we solve for x
we get X =
4451 G of HCL so we want to add 44 G
44.5 1 G of HCL to our initial 450 G of
water to create a 90 90,000 parts per
million solution of HCL
